definition: to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
more/even more/further/still/still more
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
layer/stratum/laminated/floor (of a building)/storey/classifier for layers/repeated/sheaf (math.)
surname Lou
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: We should make the quality of our products even better.
sentences.chinese: 我们要使产品质量更上一层楼。

sentences.english: I look forward to working with you to take the China-UK relationship to a new high.
sentences.chinese: 让我们共同努力，推动中英关系更上一层楼。

sentences.english: The STTA wishes Coach Liu well in his future coaching career.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡乒总祝贺刘教练的事业更上一层楼。

sentences.english: This is how they use conflict as a catapult to high performance.
sentences.chinese: 这样利用冲突，他们就能让自己的表现更上一层楼。

sentences.english: Finally, I wish my center career more hope that early today. Return.
sentences.chinese: 最后，祝我中心的事业更上一层楼，恳盼早回佳音。

sentences.english: First I'd like to wish King World Hotel a more successful new year.
sentences.chinese: 首先预祝君豪大饭店在新的一年里更上一层楼。

sentences.english: A camera supplies the data for colour sorting.
sentences.chinese: 柯尼卡胶卷使彩色摄影更上一层楼。

sentences.english: Exhausting my eyes to a thousand li further, I am ascending one more story of the tower.
sentences.chinese: 欲穷千里目，更上一层楼。

sentences.english: Konica film takes color photography to new heights.
sentences.chinese: 柯尼卡胶卷使彩色摄影更上一层楼。

sentences.english: As a result, the Sino-French cooperation in cultural exchanges will see a better day to come.
sentences.chinese: 中法合作将因文化交流而更上一层楼。

sentences.english: For a grander sight, the true meaning of a higher level.
sentences.chinese: 欲穷千里目，更上一层楼的真正含义。

definition: lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
to advance by leaps and bounds
qualitative leap
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
to promote/to upgrade
to double/to redouble/to increase many times over/to multiply by a factor/multiplication
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
to shine (of talents, skills, accomplishment)/to demonstrate extraordinary talent or skill
imminent/just around the corner (idiom)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to make a breakthrough
progress/improvement/to improve/to progress/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
correct/right/not bad/pretty good
